item.title: Marbles RTX - Artists Breakdown by Jacob Norris
item.description:
This is just a sample of the intense level of detail across the project. Please checkout each artists ArtStation to see more of their work! Everything is HAND MODELED AND TEXTURED in 3D by the team. Zero Photogrammetry

Marbles RTX was Art Directed by the Madman and Legend
Gavriil Klimov - https://www.artstation.com/hexeract

Huge props to the core team at Nvidia who put more hours into this in 2 months than should be humanly possible. You guys are amazing and built one of the best looking Environments I have ever seen! Real-time or offline!
Artur Szymczak - https://www.artstation.com/synapse
Andrej Štefančík - https://www.artstation.com/adozv
Alessandro Baldasseroni - https://www.artstation.com/baldasseroni
Fred Hooper - https://www.artstation.com/freddyhoops
Ilya Shelementsev - https://www.artstation.com/devmod
Gregor Kopka - https://www.artstation.com/scrutch

Thank you so much from the incredibly hard work and dedication from the freelancers on this project:
Anna Kaufmann - https://www.artstation.com/a_k
Egor Protonov - https://www.artstation.com/egorprotonov
Emmanuel Marshall - https://www.artstation.com/e-manual
Gabriel Cervantes - https://www.artstation.com/gabrielcervantes3d
Jonjo Hemmens - https://www.artstation.com/jonjo
Kyle Kr - https://www.artstation.com/kyle-kr
Madina Chionidi - https://www.artstation.com/tastyburger
Mario Dalla Bona - https://www.artstation.com/macebo
Matteo Mingozzi - https://www.artstation.com/mingo
Reno Lonewolf Levi - https://www.artstation.com/lonewolf3d
Samir Benounis - https://www.artstation.com/samirbb

I was responsible, along with Andrej and Gavriil for providing texturing, modeling, and general feedback to all of the artists throughout the Project. I also worked closely with Artur to place all of the assets in the scene and build out the environment, fixing bugs, and finalizing everything inside of Omniverse. I modeled and textured as many assets as I could get my hands on and left the rest to the more than capable team of artists on the project. Paul Kind and Peter Shipkov were the masterminds behind the game, gameplay, and the original concept for Marbles at Nvidia. Thank you everyone for making this a memorable and truely inspiring project to be a part of!

View this on ArtStation
Jacob Norris on ArtStation


NVIDIA Marbles RTX


Alessandro Baldasseroni - https://www.artstation.com/baldasseroni Alessandro breezed through these assets for marbles. He modeled and textured all of his own assets and was pivotal in getting this project shipped on time.


Alessandro Baldasseroni - https://www.artstation.com/baldasseroni Look at that Chalky goodness, you can see it crumbling and feel the dustyness on your hands.


Andrej Štefančík - https://www.artstation.com/adozv Andrej is easily one of the best Texture artists in the Industry. His attention to detail is unparalleled and provided tons of great feedback to the other artists throughout the project.


Andrej Štefančík - https://www.artstation.com/adozv Haha plenty of Easter Eggs inside of the Marbles Universe, here is some of the artwork Andrej created on the walls.


Andrej Štefančík - https://www.artstation.com/adozv Just beautiful. No words! Andrej modelled many of the hero assets in marbles, please go checkout his artstation to see more!


Artur Szymczak - https://www.artstation.com/synapse Artur was the gatekeeper to the Omniverse. Setting up all of our assets to work in real-time and then Lighting and placing many of them in the environment.


Artur Szymczak - https://www.artstation.com/synapse Artur's lighting pushed this project to the next level.


Artur Szymczak - https://www.artstation.com/synapse He was doing some lookdev for us early on to test the limits of using Omniverse and creating nex-gen realtime content


Fred Hooper - https://www.artstation.com/freddyhoops Fred Hooper setup all of FX for the project using a new system called Flow. Fire, spray paint, smoke, so much tastiness


Gavriil Klimov - https://www.artstation.com/hexeract Gavriil Klimov Art Directed the Project and went to extreme lengths to ensure the most realistic textures and models. Here he actually purchased props from the local art store for reference photos


Gavriil Klimov - https://www.artstation.com/hexeract He was smearing paint all over his apartment and getting proper drippage


Gregor Kopka - https://www.artstation.com/scrutch Gregor Kopka is a hard surface artist and concept designer. He designed some of these "enemy props" modeled and textured each of his assets as well as many other across the project. These are the "Pusher"


Gregor Kopka - https://www.artstation.com/scrutch All that cork that could have been used to cork some champagne... So sad, but so beautifully made


Ilya Shelementsev - https://www.artstation.com/devmod Ilya also designed and concepted many of his own assets. Along with creating these INSANE textures. This is our "Elevator" in the game. Gregor did a great job modeling this Elevator for Ilya


Ilya Shelementsev - https://www.artstation.com/devmod We have only the beesstt colors to work with in marbles. Thanks to Ilya's sick modeling and texturing


Anna Kaufmann - https://www.artstation.com/a_k This is the "Spoon Lift" asset that I modeled and was lucky enough to have Anna Kaufmann Texture it. She did an incredible job!


Anna Kaufmann - https://www.artstation.com/a_k This sink, modeled by Andrej was again in good hands when Anna brought this into Substance Painter. It's definitely an artists sink


Egor Protonov - https://www.artstation.com/egorprotonov Egor has some truely phenomenal work and every asset he textured for Marbles hit the bar and shot past it!


Egor Protonov - https://www.artstation.com/egorprotonov These curtains were modeled by Madina and her badass Marvelous Design Skills


Emmanuel Marshall - https://www.artstation.com/e-manual/albums/all This is just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to the amount of work that Emmanuel put into texturing the full room hosting marbles


Emmanuel Marshall - https://www.artstation.com/e-manual/albums/all All of those colors! they are real and how each tip feels individually used. What are you doing, go checkout more of his work already!


Gabriel Cervantes - https://www.artstation.com/gabrielcervantes3d Gabe was able to knockout both organic, man-made, and hard surface textures no problem! That's some of the best looking clay I think you've ever seen.


Gabriel Cervantes - https://www.artstation.com/gabrielcervantes3d Madina hand sculpted all of the clay assets in the gameplay space and Gabe just kept blowing away the texturing on them!


Jonjo Hemmens - https://www.artstation.com/jonjo If you haven't seen Jonjo's work before, go checkout his portfolio right now! These textures are the work of a master. The models were completed be Alessandro and Andrej


Jonjo Hemmens - https://www.artstation.com/jonjo This massive device modeled by Andrej Stefancik knocks the marbles off of the map. I died many times in the game just looking at the artwork...


Kyle Kr - https://www.artstation.com/kyle-kr Honestly, Kyle was like the 1 shot king. 1 post of his texture work and the asset was done, almost zero feedback required. This is actually real life.


Kyle Kr - https://www.artstation.com/kyle-kr Kyle also provided incredibly informative tips for UVs and helped us pioneer the real-time sub-d texturing workflow


Madina Chionidi - https://www.artstation.com/tastyburger Madina is a master of Zbrush and Marvelous Designer. We took advantage of her skills on many of the hero assets in the Marbles Game


Madina Chionidi - https://www.artstation.com/tastyburger She literally sculpted the clay slide haha. The cut marks, the little clay flakes, it's beautiful! There is even more to see on her Artstation


Mario Dalla Bona - https://www.artstation.com/macebo This old fashioned heater modeled by Andrej again (he's everywhere) received the royal treatment for texturing. Mario is a beast! I actually had to make sure this wasn't our reference on accident


Mario Dalla Bona - https://www.artstation.com/macebo I created the base cardboard model here and Gregor finalized it. Then we just let Mario do his thing on the texture work


Matteo Mingozzi - https://www.artstation.com/mingo Checkout Matteo's work if you haven't already. These are only tiny previews of his mad skills!


Matteo Mingozzi - https://www.artstation.com/mingo The inside of those paint containers actually feels like it has dried and dripping paint. I still think he cheated somehow.


Reno Lonewolf Levi - https://www.artstation.com/lonewolf3d Reno was nice enough to put me on a few Easter Eggs in marbles haha. He modeled tons of the assets for Marbles and here is some of his texturing


Reno Lonewolf Levi - https://www.artstation.com/lonewolf3d That shoebox tho... I don't know who's shoes are inside, but I want to own this thing. Beautiful work Reno!


Samir Benounis - https://www.artstation.com/samirbb These couple images of Samir's texture work don't do them justice, because you need so many more images to see all the detail. Please go checkout his own images once they are up on his Artstation!


Samir Benounis - https://www.artstation.com/samirbb How close you can get to this model and the texture work still holds up... I Thanks so much Samir for your contributions! And again some sweet models from Gregor here on the C-Clamp and Motors

item.title: Marbles RTX - Cups Chute by Jacob Norris
item.description:
This project was a huge collaboration from many brilliant artists. This project would not be possible without them, please see the full list of credits here.
https://www.artstation.com/artwork/KaXZdG

For this "Cups Chute" asset I was fully responsible for concepting the design, modeling, texturing, and placing the asset in the world.

Marbles RTX was presented at Nvidia GTC and showcases a real-time playable game built inside of Omniverse. It renders hundreds of millions of polygons at run-time on a single Graphics Card. Real world accuracy with RTX lighting, massively detailed textures, and NVIDIA physics make this one of the most realistic playable games to date. It utilizes film techniques with sub-d geometry and is built in a collaborative engine that can render film quality images in both Path Traced and Ray Traced modes. Omniverse is the future of real-time 3D content creation.

item.title: Lunar 2019 - Moon Landscape Apollo 11 by Jacob Norris
item.description:
For Siggraph 2019 we shared some incredible new AI technology that simply uses a phone/tablet camera and can estimate poses for the human body to simulate animation and proper IK in real-time. The demo was all rendered in our own engine at Nvidia called "Omniverse." Closing the gap between real-time and cinematic rendering with realtime ray tracing and RTX technology. I worked on the landscape, lighting, and post process in the scene. Astronaut and Lander artwork created by:
David Lesperance - https://www.artstation.com/artwork/QzkqXr
Alessandro Baldasseroni - https://www.artstation.com/artwork/4bvRdW
Terry Mosier - https://www.artstation.com/terrymosier

item.title: WIP - Substance Shower Drain by Jacob Norris
item.description:
So this is actually a Substance Designer project that is 2 years old now which I never finished haha and then lost the file to. I decided I wanted to at least post the WIP screenshots that I still had left of it on here.
(Inspired by true events)

The shower drain holes can easily change shape, count, layout, and size. As well as the entire drain itself can be moved around rotated and placed anywhere on the tiles which will then naturally integrate into the tile system. Water drop count, size, and hair color/size as well are adjustable parameters. It was still fun and now I am finally sharing it Enjoy!

item.title: The Gift of the Holidays 2018 by Jacob Norris
item.description:
I've gone ahead and made my older tutorials free for everyone, forever! Merry Christmas, Happy Holidays, and Happy New Years everyone!!
www.gumroad.com/purepolygons

The support I have received from all of you over the years has been huge! To all of those that picked up these tutorials from the beginning and even recently, thank you so much everyone and I hope you've enjoyed learning from them as much as I enjoyed creating them. It's only because of you, your support, contributions, and valued feedback, that I have decided to share these for free now. So from the bottom of my heart, thank you honestly. If you purchased the tutorial at any point in December this month, I will be more than happy to refund you for the tutorial. Pass on the news to anyone you think could benefit from watching these, share them around. No need to pirate and torrent them anymore hahaha

The content has been out since 2016 and I don't want to charge people for slightly older tutorials. Enjoy!

item.title: Project Sol - Real-time Ray Tracing Demo by Jacob Norris
item.description:
Real-time ray tracing, the holy grail of graphics, is now possible thanks to the NVIDIA Turing architecture and the NVIDIA RTX development platform.

This is a demo using that technology created by the art team here at Nvidia. This was a huge collaboration of artists to make this happen. Thanks to everyone involved. Please checkout this interview for more details on my involvement or the other Project Sol images on my artstation profile.
https://www.allegorithmic.com/blog/real-time-ray-tracing-future-nvidia-s-project-sol-textured-substance

For more artists work, see these guys awesome profiles!
Gavriil Klimov - www.artstation.com/hexeract
Gregor Kopka - www.artstation.com/scrutch
David Lesperance - www.artstation.com/metalman123456123
Ilya Shelementsev - www.artstation.com/devmod
Fred Hooper - www.artstation.com/freddyhoops

item.content:encoded:
Real-time ray tracing, the holy grail of graphics, is now possible thanks to the NVIDIA Turing architecture and the NVIDIA RTX development platform. This robot arm is modeled and designed by Gregor Kopka and textured and rendered by myself in Substance Painter/Designer

This is a demo using that technology created by the art team here at Nvidia. This was a huge collaboration of artists to make this happen. Thanks to everyone involved. Please checkout this interview for more details on my involvement or the other Project Sol images on my artstation profile.
https://www.allegorithmic.com/blog/real-time-ray-tracing-future-nvidia-s-project-sol-textured-substance

item.title: Tutorials - What are you Most interested in? by Jacob Norris
item.description: New tutorial incoming from Jacob Norris. What are you most interested in?
item.content:encoded:
Hi everyone, 

So I am trying out this whole Artstation blog thing :)

          I recently released a tutorial for my wood planks substance. It's been out for about a week now, so this blog post is a little late, but with that one under wraps now I wanted to make this blog post to talk with you guys and see what you're interested in or struggling with? And also what types of tutorials you are more interested in?

          This most recent tutorial is created in a "Walkthrough Format." Meaning we start from a completed substance material and I guide you through how I created the Substance, as well as my thought process behind setting up the graph. I also dive deeper into certain subjects and show specific examples by recreating parts of the graph. I have included the substance .sbs and .sbsar files, so you can follow along and see it for yourself. Although some of my past tutorials were in more of a "step-by-step" format. So I would actually talk about how I am creating something, while ACTUALLY creating it at the same time haha.


You can see some examples of the "Walkthrough Format" Wood Planks Tutorial here.

https://www.artstation.com/artwork/BrmD6

https://gumroad.com/l/Tut-PWP



Where as when it comes to the more "Step-by-Step" approach, there are some free examples on my personal blog that I have run for a while over at my website. I've had that blog on-going for the past few years with a lot more posts relating to environment art. Although, I may try a few here as well just to see how it works out. In any case, here is the step by step example

https://www.purepolygons.com/blog/tutorial-zbrush-tiling-textures


Here is my original blog for those unfamiliar with it with more examples of breakdowns or "step-by-step" examples to compare the difference.

https://www.purepolygons.com/blog


I'm looking forward to hearing your thoughts and seeing what you're interested in! Thanks for checking out my first ArtStation Blog post too haha.

Enjoy your weekend,

- Jacob

item.title: Windup - Realtime Animated Film GDC 2018 by Jacob Norris
item.description:
A long while back I had the honor of helping to work on the Unity Short "Windup" test scene for working towards creating animated film quality movies in real-time. Rendered with the Unity Engine

www.facebook.com/purepolygons

The test scene is a collaboration of Yibing Jiang, Laurent Harduin, Colin Thomas and myself.
I worked on creating many of the materials, assets, and models of the environment. Including the main tree, the building, vines, cement cylinder, parts of the ground, and some of the foliage. As well as some of the placement in the scene.

Special thanks to Melissa Chou, Sebastien Lagarde, John Parsaie, John Sweeney and Chris Kang who helped us to finish it.

For more details, please check out the slices of Yibing's GDC talk "‘Windup’: An Animation Feature Quality Rendering in Real-Time”:
http://www.yibingjiang.com/files/Windup_GDC.pptx

item.title: Nvidia - Running Boy Part - 2 by Jacob Norris
item.description:
Deep learning was used to generate realistic animations and transitions in this stylized demo for GTC 2018. Where a boy is helping a crashed ship full of robots return to their teleport pad...

www.facebook.com/purepolygons

Myself: Landscape Materials / Texturing, CharacterShaderCreation/ SSS and cloth setup, Foliage, Vertex Painted Spaceship Damage Texture, Lighting, Skybox Creation with moving clouds
Artwork performed in collaboration with Gavriil Klimov, Gregor Kopka, Erin Zaneski, Pierre Fleau, Alen Vejzovic, Fred Hooper
See more work from Pierre here: https://www.artstation.com/artwork/zZ3b2

Initial Tree Models from UE4 Marketplace

This was an AI - Deep Learning project where mo-cap was used to capture initial animations and then Artificial Intellegence blended them together and created transitions/adjust speed simply based off of the mo-cap data it had and the collision/interaction with the environment.

item.title: Isaac - VR Pretzel Bakery by Jacob Norris
item.description:
This project involved setting up a space where our Robot Isaac (controlled by a person in VR) could make a pretzel and bake it with the help of his little buddy Euclid

www.facebook.com/purepolygons

Myself: Lighting, Environment Placement / Architecture Modeling, Dough Mat + Flour Decal
Artwork performed in collaboration with Gavriil Klimov, Pierre Fleau, Gregor Kopka, Reno Levi, Johnny Costello
More work from Pierre: https://www.artstation.com/artwork/KKmly
A variety of Unreal Marketplace Assets were used in this scene

We presented this at GTC in 2018 to show more on the Isaac series and human/robot interaction tasking. Isaac makes a pretzel!
This demo dealt with soft bodies, physics, as well as expanding the knowledge of working with robotics and tasking in a virtual environment

item.title: Substance & Unreal Tutorial - Forest Snow Ground by Jacob Norris
item.description:
The tutorial is out everyone! You can download it here.
www.gumroad.com/purepolygons
Questions/Feedback:
www.facebook.com/purepolygons

Hours of awesome learning material! In this tutorial we are going through the steps of creating multiple snow substance textures. Then importing them into the Unreal Engine to blend them over our Forest ground that we made in the last tutorial. We also will create some snow clump assets, LOD's, setup foliage in the engine and a lot more. Checkout the tutorial link above for full details.
Thanks everyone!

Hours of awesome learning material! In this tutorial we are going through the steps of creating multiple snow substance textures. Then importing them into the Unreal Engine to blend them over our Forest ground that we made in the last tutorial. We also will create some snow clump assets, LOD's, setup foliage in the engine and a lot more. Checkout the tutorial link above for full details.
Thanks everyone!
